1.text: Cover your workspace with plastic or newspaper to prevent staining.

2.text: Put on old clothes and a pair of plastic gloves.

3.text: Fill a plastic container or sink with 3 US gal (11 l) of hot water.

4.text: Add 1 teaspoon (4.9 ml) of liquid dish soap to the hot water.

5.text: Stir 1⁄2 cup (120 ml) of liquid fabric dye into the hot water.

6.text: Buy white canvas sneakers or clean a pair that you already own.

7.text: Remove the shoelaces and insoles from your sneakers.

8.text: Run the canvas parts of the shoes under a faucet to wet them.

9.text: Smear a thin layer of petroleum jelly over the rubber soles.

10.text: Hold 1 shoe in each hand and line them up side by side.

11.text: Position both shoes with either the heels or the toes pointed down.

12.text: Lower the shoes slowly into the dye bath to the depth you want.

13.text: Hold the shoes in the dye bath for about 2 minutes.

14.text: Inspect the color and dip the shoes again if you want it darker.

15.text: Rinse the dyed parts of your shoes with cool water until it runs clear.

16.text: Rub the canvas with a damp cloth where the color meets white.

17.text: Drag the damp cloth through the color toward the white area.

18.text: Wash the shoes in warm water with gentle detergent.
